intro: Alsophila melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery, compound fronds. The fronds are typically dark green and have a distinctive blackish-brown midrib, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The plant plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and shelter for various forest organisms.
